boxresin.library.javahttp

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • boxresin.library.javahttp.HttpResponse

  • public class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing HTTP response. You can get information in response(ex. HTTP status code, body of a message etc) via this class.
    Since:
    v1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      @NotNull java.lang.String getBody()
      Returns content of a response message.
      @NotNull java.lang.String getBody(java.lang.String encoding)
      Returns content of a response message.
      @NotNull byte[] getBodyAsByteArray()
      Returns content of a response message.
      @Nullable java.lang.String getBodyEncoding()
      Returns encoding of content in a response message.
      @Nullable java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
      Returns a header of a response message by specified key.
      int getStatusCode()
      Returns HTTP status code of a response message.
      @NotNull java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
      Returns a description of HTTP status code.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Returns HTTP status code of a response message.
        Returns:
        HTTP status code as int type (ex. 404)
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getStatusMessage

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Returns a description of HTTP status code.
        Returns:
        Description of HTTP status code as String type (ex. "Not Found")
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getHeader

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a header of a response message by specified key. The key is case-sensitive.
        Returns:
        A header of a response message. It will be null if there's no such header.
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBody

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getBody()
        Returns content of a response message. It can be an HTML document or JSON-formatted data.
        NOTE: It detects content encoding automatically.
        Returns:
        Body of a response message as String type
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBody

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getBody(java.lang.String encoding)
                                            throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Returns content of a response message. It can be an HTML document or JSON-formatted data.
        Parameters:
        encoding - Name of charset (ex. "UTF-8")
        Returns:
        Body of a response message as String type with specified encoding
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBodyAsByteArray

        @NotNull
public @NotNull byte[] getBodyAsByteArray()
        Returns content of a response message. It can be an HTML document or JSON-formatted data.
        Returns:
        Body of a response message as byte array.
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBodyEncoding

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.String getBodyEncoding()
        Returns encoding of content in a response message. It will be null if there's no encoding information in the response header.
        NOTE: It always returns upper case.
        Returns:
        content's encoding
